data.title: Rename PlayerReference.Race to Faction
data.body:
This is the second step in a series of PRs toward unblocking #7873.
Renames `PlayerReference.Race` and `PlayerReference.LockRace` and updates ALL THE MAPS!
Only the TS shellmap is spared.
Should be pretty easy to review, actually.

data.title: Higher level timed upgrades
data.body:
Right now timed upgrades are not allowed to get past level 1, i.e., every new granting of the upgrade just refreshes the duration of the previous upgrade instead of increasing its level.

I'd like to loosen this constraint to allow timed upgrades to reach higher levels if different sources grant the same timed upgrade. Per source, however, the highest level would still remain constrained to 1, refreshing duration with every new granting instead of increasing the level. That's the first commit.

This would be used for #8563 through `GrantUpgradeWarhead`. Adapting this warhead to register itself as a source of the upgrade is what commit number two is about.

data.title: Veterancy wiki article is outdated
data.body:
https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/wiki/Veterancy needs an update.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/23746386-veterancy-wiki-article-is-outdated?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Updated the list of active developers participating in maintenance and code review
data.body:
Source: 
- https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/graphs/contributors
- https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/wiki/Changelog-(bleed)/_history

data.title: allow cursor keys to be remapped to other keys, fi asdw
data.body: Some key functions can be remapped in settings to other keys, just not the cursor keys. I would like to be able to remap the cursor keys to asdw. (and would be happy to remap the existing functions under a and d elsewhere).

data.title: Move maximum terrain height definition to mod.yaml.
data.body: One of the upcoming heightmap-related PRs needs to use this value from a place where it is not convenient to access a TileSet.  There is no reason for this value to be tileset-specific, so it has been moved to the Manifest.

data.title: Fix Team set in PlayerReference being ignored for unplayable players
data.body: Fixes #8623.

data.title: Added a warning about custom game rules
data.body: Closes https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/8651.

data.title: Indication of map with custom rules in multiplayer lobby
data.body:
It would be nice if one could see that a map contains custom rules by some kind of a indicator in the multiplayer lobby. Something similar to the "Advanced" label on the Resource Center. A player would know in front that the game may behave in a totally different way.

Especially if people are creating identical named maps with cheating-like rules and crappy trol-sounds, as I encountered this morning.

Example:
http://resource.openra.net/maps/3525 (clone)
http://resource.openra.net/maps/64/ (origional)

data.title: Render the terrain geometry over all visible terrain.
Render resources using TerrainSpriteLayers
data.body:
This changes ResourceLayer to use a set of TerrainSpriteLayers instead of generating a pile of SpriteRenderables each tick.  This should cut out a bunch of rendering work (ping @RoosterDragon) and removes a dependency on shroud / bounds that complicates the future heightmap-shroud code.

This is mainly a proof of concept: if it's viable, then followup prs will apply the same approach to `EditorResourceLayer`, `SmudgeLayer`, and `BuildableTerrainLayer`.

data.title: Changed the Coverity results contact to a mailing list
data.body: It was tied to my personal e-Mail which was okay during the testing phase. This changes it to post to the mailing list at https://launchpad.net/~openra-developers which anyone can subscribe to.

data.title: world.RenderPlayer should be moved to WorldRenderer
data.body:
The `FogObscures` and `ShroudObscures` methods too.  This field and these methods are not to be used for world state, so do not belong where they are.

This is easier said than done however: they are used from several places that do not have an easily accessible WorldRenderer. 
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/23722830-world-renderplayer-should-be-moved-to-worldrenderer?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Remove unused/duplicated minimap code.
Fixed missing null checks in FieldLoader
data.body: Coverity only highlights one case, but most functions are affected that do string operations before try-parsing the value. This time I also looked at the greyed out lines to fix this defect once and for all.

data.title: Fixed missing braces breaking the upgrade rules
data.body: This happened again. I think I already complained last time that we should not enforce the unwritten omit braces for one liners style rule which leads to problems when those conditions are later expanded. The good news is: Coverity detects these problems!

data.title: Removed bogus Selectable from RA crate
data.body: And increased bounds for tooltips etc. on shipping mods.

data.title: Added separate CloseSequence to WithLandingCraftAnimation
data.body:
Closing sequence of landing craft is no longer hardcoded to be a reversed opening sequence.

This also fixes (or let's say avoids) the visual glitch that you see when moving an open landing craft away from the shore.
The underlying problem behind the above glitch appears to be an issue with playing animations backwards, which is now no longer used by this trait.

Additionally, modified `WithAttackAnimation` and `WithMoveAnimation` to work with `WithSpriteBody` as well, not just `WithFacingSpriteBody`.

data.title: Added exception handling to ExportCharacterSeparatedRules
data.body: Closes #8546

data.title: Fixed Warning: Sprite image delphi from actor DELPHI does not define sequence shoot
data.body: Revealed by https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/8634.

data.title: A few map / bounds cleanups.
data.body:
This cleans up a couple of self-contained issues before the big push to introduce projected cell coordinates for map bounds and shroud queries.

There are four parts to this:
- Making #8549 suck a little less (fixes the bonus point until we can eventually remove the offending API).
- Cleaning up the map creation code a little now the legacy editor is gone.
- Renaming `WorldRenderer.Position` to reflect that it isn't giving a real world position.
- Cleaning up some incorrect coordinate checks that are otherwise broken by a future change.

data.title: Screen resolution rendering
data.body:
About once every 20 times I run openRA, the resolution stretches vertically off the top of the screen and buttons are hard to click on. In the screenshot attached, the mouse is over the button, but it does not give the visual hover until the mouse is dragged further down. The top of the border is off the screen and text is rendered with artefacts.

Ubuntu 14.04lts x64

http://i.imgur.com/4i4ayjL.png

data.title: Updated the utility
data.body:
Modified the commands layout to be more readable and applied some refactorings to the code.

Before:
![3](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11020536/8508690/ca5fd2b8-2282-11e5-9ada-ce04d85e98c1.png)
After:
![2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11020536/8508691/cdf50e7a-2282-11e5-9a0c-1bf37b17f385.png)

data.title: Added the in-game IRC client again
data.body: This time using http://smartirc4net.meebey.net by @Meebey.

data.title: Move Warheads from the engine to Mods.Common
data.body:
Introduces `IWarhead` to enable moving `Warhead` and `DamageWarhead` outside of the engine and into `OpenRA.Mods.Common.Warheads`, where they belong.
Split into several commits to make reviewing easier.
This is the last step before `Armor` can be moved to `Mods.Common` and made upgradable.

data.title: Fix issues with civilian infantry in RA
data.body: Introduced in #8515.

data.title: Game Crash - RA Skirmish
data.body:
Have had this a few times, and the reccuring theme is this happens when a building/unit is about to die/etc.

In the YAMLs, I do have one additional vehicle, one additional missile, one additional small-cal weapon, however even with my modifications removed the game still crashes in the same fashion.

Have reinstalled twice and used different maps, no change.

> Red Alert Mod at Version playtest-20150628
> Operating System: Windows (Microsoft Windows NT 6.1.7601 Service Pack 1)

data.title: Removed the OpenAL/OpenGL/SDL2 dependency from the game engine
data.body:
I removed the OpenAL (and subsequent OpenTK) dependency from OpenRA.Game and placed it into the renderer DLLs, which in fact do a lot more than just rendering nowadays (input, window creation, etc.) so I renamed things to reflect this.

Our SDL2/OpenGL/OpenAL combination works fine, but isn't far from ideal. Now it is possible for anyone to create a DirectX platform DLL or something more light weight new based on GLFW or other stripped down OpenGL bindings etc.

Closes #5274.

data.title: Fixed a null reference exception in FieldLoader.ParseYesNo
data.body: Detected by Coverity.

data.title: Remove target line drawing in settings
data.body: Adds an option in the settings to turn off the drawing of lines from units to their target. Closes #6915. Useful for visibility while moving large amount of units.
